div.em: Current conditions as of 26 Apr 15:56 pm CDT

div.div: Partly cloudy, with a low around 47. South wind 9 to 14 mph, with gusts as high as 20 mph.
Sunny, with a high near 78. South wind 5 to 7 mph becoming north in the afternoon.

A chance of showers and thunderstorms before 4am, then showers likely and possibly a thunderstorm between 4am and 5am, then a chance of showers and thunderstorms after 5am. Increasing clouds, with a low around 54. East northeast wind 5 to 9 mph becoming south after midnight. Chance of precipitation is 60%. New rainfall amounts of less than a tenth of an inch, except higher amounts possible in thunderstorms.

Increasing clouds, with a low around 54. East northeast wind 5 to 9 mph becoming south after midnight. Chance of precipitation is 60%. New rainfall amounts of less than a tenth of an inch, except higher amounts possible in thunderstorms.

span.span: Notice is hereby given that the Board of Education of School District #1 of Madison, Nebraska will hold a regular board of education meeting at 7:00 p.m. on Monday, May 11, 2020, in the Commons of Madison Middle/High School which meeting shall be open to the public. The Board reserves the right to offer this meeting via Videoconference if due to the COVID-19 outbreak a quorum of the Board members are unable to attend the meeting. A link will be provided to the public on the school’s districts website three to four days prior to the meeting date if anyone would like to participate in the board meeting. This meeting will be offered by video conference to the public during the COVID-19 outbreak. An agenda for such meeting, kept continuously current, is available for public inspection in the Superintendent's office located at Madison High School.

a.aria-label: Read more about Notice of Regular Meeting

span.span: Your school nurses care about you and your families and how you're all doing 🙂

font.font: We will be having virtual nurse "office

hours" tomorrow, Wednesday, April 22, for one hour, from 11:00 AM - 12:00 PM. Please join us by clicking the link below. We are here for you - you may ask questions, get the latest health updates from the health department/CDC, or just simply talk and have someone listen.

The Madison Public School District does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, marital status, age or handicap in admission or access to, or the treatment in it’s programs and activities.
